intro: Maba euphlebia, commonly known as the golden maba, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, three-winged seeds.
